name: System & Communications Protection (Monitor, control, and protect organizational communications)

items.question: SC.L1-3.13.1 - Monitor and control system communications
Requirements: Implement network monitoring and boundary protection including firewalls, intrusion detection, and communication controls.

answers.text: Fully Implemented - All boundary protection controls are in place and operational
Partially Implemented - Some boundary protection controls exist but gaps remain
Not Implemented - No boundary protection controls currently in place

value.text: Fully Implemented - All boundary protection controls are in place and operational

items.question: SC.L1-3.13.5 - Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible components
Requirements: Create DMZ or separated network segments for public-facing systems to isolate them from internal networks.

answers.text: Fully Implemented - DMZ/subnetworks properly isolate public systems
Partially Implemented - Some separation exists but not comprehensive
Not Implemented - No network separation for public systems

value.text: Fully Implemented - DMZ/subnetworks properly isolate public systems

items.question: 1. Publicly Accessible System Components
What publicly accessible system components does your organization operate?

items.codingInstructions: Identify and manage system components like web servers, email servers, and public applications that are accessible to external users
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Identify and manage system components like web servers, email servers, and public applications that are accessible to external users

items.question: 2. Network Separation Implementation
How are publicly accessible systems separated from internal networks?

answers.text: Firewall rules and access control lists

value.text: Firewall rules and access control lists

items.codingInstructions: Implement measures to separate and segment networks to limit unauthorized access and contain potential security breaches.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Implement measures to separate and segment networks to limit unauthorized access and contain potential security breaches.

items.question: 3. Access Control Between Networks
What controls prevent unauthorized access from public networks to internal networks?

answers.text: Default deny policies (all traffic blocked unless explicitly allowed)
Strong authentication for any allowed connections

value.text: Default deny policies (all traffic blocked unless explicitly allowed)
Strong authentication for any allowed connections

items.codingInstructions: Control and restrict communication between networks to prevent unauthorized access and data transfer.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Control and restrict communication between networks to prevent unauthorized access and data transfer.
